dt: {bc}to offer to take part in a {d_link|proffer session|proffer session}

dt.t: decided that an indictment was unlikely and there was no reason to {wi}proffer{/wi}

et: Middle English {it}profren{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}profrer, proffrir, porofrir{/it}, from {it}por-{/it} forth (from Latin {it}pro-{/it}) + {it}offrir{/it} to offer {ma}{mat|pro-|}{/ma}
shortdef: to present for acceptance : tender, offer
to offer to take part in a proffer session

dt: {bc}an offer made to a prosecutor by a person who is a subject of a criminal investigation to provide information in exchange for limited immunity or a {d_link|plea bargaining|plea bargaining} agreement

dt.t: made a {wi}proffer{/wi} in the hope of avoiding prosecution

shortdef: an offer made to a prosecutor by a person who is a subject of a criminal investigation to provide information in exchange for limited immunity or a plea bargaining agreement

dt: {bc}a letter setting forth an agreement between a federal prosecutor and a person who is a subject of a criminal investigation stating that the subject will provide information to aid the investigation and that the information provided will not be used against the subject in the criminal proceeding

dt.t: Though an agreement had been informally worked out, the prosecutor's {wi}proffer letter{/wi} made no mention of the plea bargain.

shortdef: a letter setting forth an agreement between a federal prosecutor and a person who is a subject of a criminal investigation stating that the subject will provide information to aid the investigation and that the information provided will not be used against the subject in the criminal proceeding

dt: {bc}a meeting between a person who is a subject of a federal criminal investigation, the person's lawyer, and a prosecutor or investigator subject to the terms of a {d_link|proffer letter|proffer letter}

dt.t: {wi}Proffer sessions{/wi} are meetings between prosecutors and individuals who are the focus of an ongoing investigation. They are commonplace in criminal investigations. While a {wi}proffer session{/wi} carries the potential to reduce or resolve a client's criminal exposure, it also presents a great deal of risk.

shortdef: a meeting between a person who is a subject of a federal criminal investigation, the person's lawyer, and a prosecutor or investigator subject to the terms of a proffer letter
